data.chText: 限度；限制
data.enText: a point at which sth stops being possible or existing

data.chText: 我们能忍受的疼痛是有限度的。
data.enText: There is a limit to the amount of pain we can bear.

data.chText: 这个队已竭尽全力。
data.enText: The team performed to the limit of its capabilities.

data.chText: 她知道自己的权限。
data.enText: She knew the limits of her power.

data.chText: 推 / 拉 / 考查某人（或某物）达到限度
data.enText: to push/stretch/test sb/sth to the limit

data.chText: 他极其傲慢。
data.enText: His arrogance knew (= had) no limits .

data.chText: 极限；限量；限额
data.enText: the greatest or smallest amount of sth that is allowed

data.chText: 时间 / 速度 / 年龄限制
data.enText: a time/speed/age limit

data.chText: 欧盟对污染程度作了严格的限制。
data.enText: The EU has set strict limits on levels of pollution.

data.chText: 他们正以两倍于法定限速的速度行驶。
data.enText: They were travelling at a speed that was double the legal limit .

data.chText: 你饮酒过量，不能驾车。
data.enText: You can't drive─you're over the limit (= you have drunk more alcohol than is legal when driving) .

data.chText: （地区或地方的）境界，界限，范围
data.enText: the furthest edge of an area or a place

data.chText: 我们快到蛮荒地界了。
data.enText: We were reaching the limits of civilization.

data.chText: 市区范围
data.enText: the city limits (= the imaginary line which officially divides the city from the area outside)
be the limit

data.chText: 极其令人讨厌
data.enText: to be extremely annoying
within limits

data.chText: 在某种程度上；有一定限制
data.enText: to some extent; with some restrictions

data.chText: 我愿意帮忙，可有一定的限度。
data.enText: I'm willing to help, within limits.

data.chText: 限制；限定
data.enText: to stop sth from increasing beyond a particular amount or level

data.chText: 限制汽车二氧化碳排放的措施
data.enText: measures to limit carbon dioxide emissions from cars

data.chText: 你要消费的金额限制着你的选择。
data.enText: The amount of money you have to spend will limit your choice.

data.chText: 限量；减量
data.enText: to restrict or reduce the amount of sth that you or sb can have or use

data.chText: 每户限发四张免费票。
data.enText: Families are limited to four free tickets each.

data.chText: 我为了试着减肥，限定自己每天摄入1 000卡的热量。
data.enText: I've limited myself to 1 000 calories a day to try and lose weight.
limit sth to sb/sth

data.chText: 使（某事只在某地或某群体内）存在（或发生）
data.enText: to make sth exist or happen only in a particular place or within a particular group

data.chText: 暴力犯罪并不局限于大城市。
data.enText: Violent crime is not limited to big cities.

data.chText: 教授历史不应该局限于讲年代和人物。
data.enText: The teaching of history should not be limited to dates and figures.

data.text: limit ♦ restriction ♦ control ♦ constraint ♦ restraint ♦ limitation

data.chText: 以上各词均表示限制或限定。
data.enText: These are all words for sth that limits what you can do or what can happen.
limit

data.chText: 指极限、限量、限额：
data.enText: the greatest or smallest amount of sth that is allowed

data.chText: 欧盟对污染程度订下了严格的限制。
data.enText: The EU has set strict limits on pollution levels.

data.chText: 速度限制
data.enText: the speed limit
restriction

data.chText: 指限制规定、限制法规：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a rule or law that limits what you can do

data.chText: 取款没有限额。
data.enText: There are no restrictions on the amount of money you can withdraw.
control

data.chText: （常构成复合词）指限制、约束、管理、管制：
data.enText: (often in compounds) the act of limiting or managing sth; a method of doing this

data.chText: 军备控制
data.enText: arms control
constraint

data.chText: 指限制、限定、约束：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a fact or decision that limits what you can do

data.chText: 我们必须在时间紧迫、资金紧张的限制下工作。
data.enText: We have to work within severe constraints of time and money.
restraint

data.chText: 指约束力、管制措施、制约因素、控制、限制：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a decision, a rule, an idea, etc. that limits what you can do; the act of limiting sth because it is necessary or sensible to do so

data.chText: 政府对一些产品实行了出口控制。
data.enText: The government has imposed export restraints on some products.

data.chText: 工会不大可能接受任何形式的工资限制。
data.enText: The unions are unlikely to accept any sort of wage restraint.
limitation

data.chText: 指限制、控制、起限制作用的规则、事实或条件：
data.enText: the act or process of limiting sth; a rule, fact or condition that limits sth

data.chText: 他们会抵制对他们权力的任何限制。
data.enText: They would resist any limitation of their powers.

data.chText: 用restriction、constraint、restraint还是limitation？
以上各词均表示限制规定。restriction指掌权者所作的限制规定或法规。constraint指现存的、也可能是由于某人的决定而存在的限制或约束。restraint亦指现存的限制或制约因素，可能是由于他人的决定而存在于自身之外的限制，也可能是由于担心别人的想法而自设的限制：
data.enText: These are all things that limit what you can do. A restriction is rule or law that is made by sb in authority. A constraint is sth that exists rather than sth that is made, although it may exist as a result of sb's decision. A restraint is also sth that exists: it can exist outside yourself, as the result of sb else's decision; but it can also exist inside you, as a fear of what other people may think or as your own feeling about what is acceptable.

data.chText: 道德 / 社会 / 文化制约因素
data.enText: moral/social/cultural restraints

data.chText: limitation较通用，可指人为的规定，也可指客观存在的构成限制的事实或情况。
data.enText: A limitation is more general and can be a rule that sb makes or a fact or condition that exists.
restriction, constraint, restraint or limitation?
limits/restrictions/controls/constraints/restraints/limitations on sth
limits/limitations to sth
tight/severe limits/restrictions/controls/constraints/restraints/limitations
economic/legal/spending limits/restrictions/controls/constraints/restraints/limitations
pay/wage limits/restrictions/controls/constraints/restraints
moral limits/restrictions/constraints/restraints/limitations
to impose/remove/lift limits/restrictions/controls/constraints/restraints/limitations

simple_means.memory_skill: lim 门槛，引申为“限制” + it → 限制

means: (地区或地方的)境界，界限，范围

ex.enText: His talk is limited to 30 minutes.

synonyms.bx: 指在时间、数量、水平等方面加以限制，侧重事物的限度。

ex.chText: 他们把研究限定在12个案例以内。
ex.enText: They confined their study to 12 cases.

ex.chText: 此项工作不会局限于这一地区。
ex.enText: The work will not be confined to this area.

synonyms.bx: 指将某人或某事物限制在某活动、主题、地区等范围之内，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 你可以限制某些文档的传阅人数。
ex.enText: You can restrict access to certain files.

synonyms.bx: 指控制某事物的大小、数量或范围，侧重限制行为。

data.enText: be the limit

data.chText: 极其令人讨厌
data.enText: to be extremely annoying
within limits

data.chText: 在某种程度上；有一定限制
data.enText: to some extent; with some restrictions

data.chText: 我愿意帮忙，可有一定的限度。
data.enText: I'm willing to help, within limits.
the sky's the limit

data.chText: 无穷尽；什么都可能；不可限量
data.enText: there is no limit to what sb can achieve, earn, do, etc.

data.chText: 以他的禀赋，前途不可限量。
data.enText: With a talent like his, the sky's the limit.
limit sth to sb/sth

data.chText: 使（某事只在某地或某群体内）存在（或发生）
data.enText: to make sth exist or happen only in a particular place or within a particular group

data.chText: 暴力犯罪并不局限于大城市。
data.enText: Violent crime is not limited to big cities.

data.chText: 教授历史不应该局限于讲年代和人物。
data.enText: The teaching of history should not be limited to dates and figures.

tr: the greatest possible degree of something
example: what he did was beyond the bounds of acceptable behavior
to the limit of his ability

tr: the boundary of a specific area
as far as something can go
the greatest amount of something that is possible or allowed
example: there are limits on the amount you can bet
it is growing rapidly with no limitation in sight

tr: the mathematical value toward which a function goes as the independent variable approaches infinity

example: restrict the use of this parking lot
limit the time you can spend with your friends

tr: restrict or confine, "I limit you to two visits to the pub a day"

value.def: A limit is the greatest amount, extent, or degree of something that is possible.

example.ex: Her love for him was being tested to its limits...
example.tran: 她对他的爱经受着极其严峻的考验。

example.ex: There is no limit to how much fresh fruit you can eat in a day...
example.tran: 每天食用多少新鲜水果都可以。

example.ex: Firefighters are being stretched to the limit as fire sweeps through the drought-stricken state.
example.tran: 火势在这个遭受旱灾的州里迅速蔓延，消防队员疲于应对，接近极限。

value.def: A limit of a particular kind is the largest or smallest amount of something such as time or money that is allowed because of a rule, law, or decision.

example.ex: The three month time limit will be up in mid-June...
example.tran: 3个月的限期截至6月中旬。

example.ex: The economic affairs minister announced limits on petrol sales.
example.tran: 经济部长宣布了对石油销售的限制。

value.def: The limit of an area is its boundary or edge.

example.ex: ...the city limits of Baghdad.
example.tran: 巴格达市区

value.def: The limits of a situation are the facts involved in it which make only some actions or results possible.

example.ex: She has to work within the limits of a fairly tight budget...
example.tran: 她不得不在相当紧张的预算范围内精打细算。

example.ex: He outlined the limits of British power.
example.tran: 他勾画了英国的势力范围。

value.def: If you limit something, you prevent it from becoming greater than a particular amount or degree.

example.ex: He limited payments on the country's foreign debt...
example.tran: 他对该国外债的偿还作出了限制。

example.ex: The view was that the economy would grow by 2.25 per cent. This would limit unemployment to around 2.5 million.
example.tran: 这一观点认为经济将会增长2.25%，这将把失业人数限定在250万左右。

value.def: If you limit yourself to something, or if someone or something limits you, the number of things that you have or do is reduced.

example.ex: It is now accepted that men should limit themselves to 20 units of alcohol a week...
example.tran: 现在人们已经接受，男性一周饮酒量不应超过20个单位。

example.ex: Voters cut councillors' pay and limited them to one staff member each.
example.tran: 选民削减了市政会委员的薪酬，并且限定他们每人只配一个工作人员。

example.ex: The conditions laid down to me were not too limiting.
example.tran: 给我规定的条件还不算太苛刻。

value.def: If something is limited to a particular place or group of people, it exists only in that place, or is had or done only by that group.

example.ex: The protests were not limited to New York...
example.tran: 抗议活动不只限于纽约。

example.ex: Entry to this prize draw is limited to UK residents.
example.tran: 这次抽奖只限英国公民参加。

value.def: If an area or a place is off limits, you are not allowed to go there.

example.ex: A one-mile area around the wreck is still off limits...
example.tran: 沉船方圆一英里内仍然禁止进入。

example.ex: These establishments are off limits to ordinary citizens.
example.tran: 这些建筑禁止普通公民入内。

value.def: If you say that something is off limits, you mean that you are not allowed to do it.

example.ex: Smoking was off limits everywhere.
example.tran: 到处都禁止吸烟。

value.def: If someone is over the limit, they have drunk more alcohol than they are legally allowed to when driving a vehicle.

example.ex: If police breathalyse me and find I am over the limit I face a long ban...
example.tran: 如果警察对我作呼气测醉试验，发现我饮酒过量，我将会被禁驾很长时间。

example.ex: He was found to be three times over the limit.
example.tran: 他血液中的酒精浓度是允许极限的3倍。

value.tran: （驾驶时）血液中酒精浓度超标的

value.def: If you say the sky is the limit, you mean that there is nothing to prevent someone or something from being very successful.

example.ex: They have found that, in terms of both salary and career success, the sky is the limit.
example.tran: 他们发现，就收入和事业成功来讲，多高都有可能的。

value.tran: 没有任何限制；一切都是可能的（或能达到的）

value.def: If you add within limits to a statement, you mean that it is true or applies only when talking about reasonable or normal situations.

example.ex: In the circumstances we'll tell you what we can, within limits, of course, and in confidence.
example.tran: 在这种情况下，我们会把能告诉你的都告诉你，当然这是有限度的，而且需要保密。

value.tran: 在一定范围内；有限度地

trans: 速度限制；(道路的)最高车速限制，限速
挑战极限；到极限；惊爆死亡线；冲向极限；到最大限度
无限地；没有限制；无限度，无可估量
极限分析；極限分析；极限解析法；极限分析法
塑限；弹性阶段；塑性限度；性阶段；塑性限界
极限循环；极限环，极限周值
液限；流限；液性限度；液性限度

rootsaffixes.indicate: = threshold 门槛 , 引申为“限制”
rootsaffixes.title: limin, lim

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 加强 + limit 限制 → 定界限
e 出 + limin 门槛，引申为“限制” + ate 做，造成，使… → 消除对事物的限制 → 消除

partsOfSpeech.d: 不稳定；中间状态（原指地狱的边境）

partsOfSpeech.dec: lim 门槛，引申为“限制” + it → 限制
lim 门槛，引申为“限制” + p → 走路受限制的 → 跛行
pre 前 + limin 门槛，引申为“限制” + ary …的 → 入门前的 → 初步的
sub 接近 + lim 门槛，引申为“限制” + ate 做，造成，使… → 接近极限 → 升华
sub 接近 + lim 门槛，引申为“限制” + e → 接近人的极限，升华成神 → 崇高的
sub 下 + limin 门槛，引申为“限制” + al …的 → 被限制在下面的，出于无形意识的 → 潜意识的
